title: 111_hr5333
content: The Act titled "Children of Military Service Members Commemorative Lapel Pin Act" allows for the Department of Defense to recognize dependent children of members of the Armed Forces. The Act establishes a lapel button for eligible children of military service members serving on active duty for over 30 days. The Secretary of Defense will approve the design and application process for eligible children to receive the button upon payment of a fee. The Act establishes a children of military service members commemorative lapel button for eligible child dependents of members serving on active duty. The presentation of the lapel button is subject to covering manufacturing and distribution costs. Each eligible child dependent may receive only one lapel button, but if they are dependent on multiple members, they can receive a button for each member. If a button is lost or damaged without fault, a replacement may be provided. The Act establishes a children of military service members commemorative lapel button for eligible child dependents of members serving on active duty. If a lapel button is lost or damaged without fault, the Secretary concerned may replace it upon application and payment of manufacturing costs. Regulations will be issued by the Secretary of Defense to ensure uniformity across armed forces. The Act establishes a children of military service members commemorative lapel button for eligible child dependents of members serving on active duty. Congress urges expedited design, manufacture, and issuance of the lapel button. The Secretary of Defense is required to make the lapel button available retroactively to those who can prove eligibility. The children of military service members commemorative lapel button is authorized by law for eligible child dependents of Armed Forces members who served on active duty for more than 30 days. The Secretary of Defense will provide a process for eligible individuals to apply for the lapel button, and will notify qualifying members of its availability. The Defense Department will notify eligible Armed Forces members about the children of military service members commemorative lapel button within 60 days of the Act's enactment. Applications must be submitted within one year of the announcement of the button's availability. Costs, limitations, and exceptions will apply to the presentation of the lapel button.
